comments.body: Plus it'd be great to make it possible to load python module_utils from a namespace other than ansible.module_utils. for third party modules that don't make sense to include in ansible proper. :)

@cognifloyd you should talk to me (abadger1999) and nitzmahone on irc.  I think what you're asking for is already possible (in 2.4.x) or impossible but I'd need to talk with you to determine which it is.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +89,93 @@    for python modules.  The powershell modules always include a single,
    hardcoded powershell module_utils file.  If we add generic module_utils
    for powershell, we'll need to decide how to organize the code.

Static Loop Keyword

comments.body:
Per network-meeting: 

> No changes will be done in 2.5, we may add some of the missing platform specific modules under the `net_` (platform agnostic) versions, which will include DI, though again, we are not going to change anything here  (gundalow, 16:12:19)


Has this changed? pinging @gundalow @privateip
@calfonso can you speak to this also?

@thaumos @itdependsnetworks we had already started on NXOS for 2.4, it's not a new platform we are adding. We ran out of time for 2.4, so picking up some of the stuff we didn't get done. We are not changing how DI is designed in 2.5.

Can you explain this on the weekly network meeting? The whole issue about DI was it was not well defined or understood. It was agreed it would take to long to clearly document, but there is time to add to the featureset?

@itdependsnetworks I'm not aware of the time constraint around documentation. The documentation discussion was about how we want to advertise DI modules and the direction we should have other people take when implementing modules. For the platforms we already implemented using DI, we are taking time to finish up some features we didn't get to. What else do you want to know?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +182,186 @@---------------
- Refactor common network shared code into package
- Convert various nxos modules to leverage declarative intent 
- Refactor various modules to leverage the cliconf plugin
- Add various missing declarative modules for supported platforms and functions
